Homs was the first major city in Syria where the revolt to unseat Assad took root in 2011 .

Its fall caps a year of regime battlefield successes : regaining the Qalamoun region between Damascus and Homs , driving rebel forces further from central Damascus , and crushing opposition pockets between Homs and Tartous on the coast .
The recent successes will likely reinforce the emerging de facto partition of Syria , with the regime holding the western half and the rebels controlling the north and east .
